text: Hi. Yes, you can use personalization in a href to create this kind of URL. I have a similar case, but its in deal/contact based WF, and it work well.

Hi Darian, and thanks for you feedback.
I have put the following url  <https://app.HubSpot.com/quotes/{{> quote.hs_object_id' }} in my email but it doesn't work.
It looks like the token was not added.
Here is the final link that I received. <https://app.HubSpot.com/quotes/?utm_campaign=UJ_B2B&utm_medium=email&_hsmi=96675708&_hsenc=p2ANqtz-8rTCYtqUPixZa0cYqWnRQpLq298k1jMS3a9ddicFA7oum9pJFW0_d-qQapxPWqva2cZNs8Beg25PiSnKU5Z-Xke8gilShDiO0Gx1nZXyjLDIRM1Ts&utm_content=96675708&utm_source=hs_automation>
Is my link properly set up according to you ? : <https://app.HubSpot.com/quotes/{{> quote.hs_object_id }}
Give me prinscreen of quote ID property in HS.
This link is not correct, I don't see any id init, only tracking
In the line 12 is the call to action with the token. I put in the line 15 the token that i can display and that i want to be in the link
i don't know where i can find quote properties
What I want is actually to push this link into an email.

I have come up with the work around. At the quote creation, the sales partner who generate the quote will update a custom deal property with the link of the quote. I will then use this custom deal property to customize my emails in my reminders workflow (deal based)
By doing so, i customize my email with token from the deals and not from the quote, which are much harder to get.
Sorry, I didn't saw this message before.
